20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.title: Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence
20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.description:
In this week’s episode of The Learning Curve, co-hosts Alisha Searcy and Massachusetts civics teacher Kelley Brown interview Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jack Rakove, Coe Professor Emeritus at Stanford University. Prof. Rakove explores the origins of the American Revolution and U.S. Constitution through the lives of the nation’s Founding Era figures. Reflecting on young John Adams’ vivid depiction of his schoolhouse in colonial Massachusetts, Rakove offers context for the political and social landscape of the 18th-century America.

The post Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

BOSTON, MA — The Pioneer New England Legal Foundation (Legal Foundation), Greater Boston Legal Services (GBLS), and law firm Greenberg Traurig filed an amicus brief with the U.S. Supreme Court in support of homeowners in two Michigan cases that could determine how far governments can go in taking property for unpaid taxes. 

The post Legal Advocates Ask Supreme Court to End Home Equity Seizures in Tax Foreclosures  appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.title: The Blueprint for Property Tax Reform: Spending Restraint
9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.description:
Taxpayers must be protected from unchecked growth in local government spending. Statewide limits on tax increases would do that while forcing local governments to live within their means. Iowa, where local governments will collect a combined $6.4 billion in property taxes this fiscal year, illustrates the potential impact of such a reform. Over the past two decades property tax collections in the state have increased by close to 110 percent, surpassing both inflation and population growth.

The post The Blueprint for Property Tax Reform: Spending Restraint appeared first on ITR Foundation.
